unnormalised: IIT Bombay has announced a new course on AI ethics, starting from 15/07/2024. The course, led by Prof. Rajesh Kumar, aims to address the challenges of bias in AI algorithms and responsible development practices. Enrollment is capped at 100 students for the initial offering.
normalised: I-I-T Bombay has announced a new course on A-I ethics, starting from fifteenth july two thousand and twenty four. The course, led by Professor Rajesh Kumar, aims to address the challenges of bias in A-I algorithms and responsible development practices. Enrollment is capped at one hundred students for the initial offering.

unnormalised: The curriculum will cover topics such as data privacy, algorithmic transparency, and the societal impact of AI. Industry experts from TCS and Infosys are scheduled to give guest lectures. Successful completion of the course will earn students 3 credits towards their degree.
normalised: The curriculum will cover topics such as data privacy, algorithmic transparency, and the societal impact of A-I. Industry experts from T-C-S and Infosys are scheduled to give guest lectures. Successful completion of the course will earn students three credits towards their degree.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the institute has allocated Rs. 50 lakh towards AI research grants for the upcoming academic year. They also plan to partner with Google AI for collaborative projects. Application details are available on their website until 30/06/2024.
normalised: Furthermore, the institute has allocated rupees fifty lakh towards A-I research grants for the upcoming academic year. They also plan to partner with Google A-I for collaborative projects. Application details are available on their website until thirtieth june two thousand and twenty four.
